column2: Gmail SMTP throws config reloader error on sign-up
column14: "Google Workspace Admin blocks SMTP relay for external apps. smtp.gmail.com:587 with App Password fails with Error 500: config reloader is exiting on the Supabase SMTP handler."
column15: "1. Configure Supabase SMTP with smtp.gmail.com:587 and Info@edmeca.co.za App Password. 2. Navigate to /login > Sign Up. 3. Enter valid email and password. 4. Click Create Account. 5. Observe 500 error in browser console."
column16: Sign-up succeeds and confirmation email delivered
column17: Error: SMTP config reloader is exiting. Sign-up fails for all new users.
column18: "Removed Gmail SMTP configuration from Supabase. Switched to Resend email delivery service. Created Resend API key. Added DNS records: DKIM TXT (resend._domainkey)
column20: MX (send). Configured Supabase SMTP: smtp.resend.com:465 with API key as password."
column27: "Google Workspace admin setting (Allow less secure apps / SMTP relay) was disabled. App Passwords tried but blocked at Google level. Resend used as permanent replacement."

column2: Confirmation email delivered to spam folder
column14: "No DMARC policy record in DNS. New sender domain (edmeca.co.za) with no historical sending reputation causes Gmail to classify mail as spam or junk."
column15: "1. Configure Resend as SMTP with DKIM and SPF only (no DMARC). 2. Complete sign-up flow. 3. Check Gmail inbox primary tab. 4. Check spam/junk folder."
column16: Confirmation email arrives in primary Gmail inbox
column17: Confirmation email received in spam / junk folder
column18: "Added DMARC TXT record to IT-Guru DNS: _dmarc.edmeca.co.za → v=DMARC1; p=none; rua=mailto:Info@edmeca.co.za. Deliverability to improve as sender reputation builds over time."
column25: "DMARC p=none (monitor mode) chosen to avoid blocking legitimate mail during initial setup. Can escalate to p=quarantine after monitoring period. Gmail reputation improvement is gradual."

column2: Login button navigates despite disabled attribute
column14: "Production Header.tsx wrapped disabled <button> in <a href=/login> anchor tag. HTML disabled attribute only applies to form elements; <a> ignores it. Clicking the button area still triggered anchor navigation."
column15: "1. Ensure VITE_ENABLE_LOGIN is not set in environment. 2. Build and deploy to production. 3. Navigate to https://edmeca.co.za. 4. Click the Log In button. 5. Observe navigation to /login despite button appearing disabled."
column16: Clicking disabled login button produces no action
column17: Clicking disabled login button navigates to /login page
column18: "Refactored Header.tsx: isLoginEnabled = import.meta.env.VITE_ENABLE_LOGIN === 'true'. When false: render plain disabled <button> only with no anchor wrapper. When true: render <a href=/login> wrapping <button>."
column25: "Fix also applied to mobile navigation menu. Both desktop and mobile login buttons use same isLoginEnabled conditional."
